intro: Ecbolium tranquebariense, commonly known as the Madras thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy pulp. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
